喪.definition: to lose sth abstract but important (courage, authority, one's life etc); to be bereaved of (one's spouse etc); to die; disappointed; discouraged

喪偶.definition: (literary) to be bereaved of one's spouse

喪失殆盡.definition: to be used up; to be exhausted

喪妻.definition: to be bereaved of one's wife

喪家之犬.definition: lit. stray dog (idiom); fig. one who has nothing to rely on

喪家之狗.definition: see 喪家之犬|丧家之犬[sang4jia1 zhi1 quan3]

喪志.definition: to become demoralized; to lose one's sense of purpose

喪棒.definition: funeral stick (held by the son as a sign of filial piety)

喪權辱國.definition: to forfeit sovereignty and humiliate the country (idiom); to surrender territory under humiliating terms

喪氣鬼.definition: downcast wretch; bad-tempered and unpleasant person

喪父.definition: to be orphaned of one's father

喪生.definition: to die; to lose one's life

喪盡.definition: to completely lose (one's dignity, vitality etc)

喪膽.definition: panic-stricken; scared out of one's wits

喪門星.definition: messenger of death; person bringing bad luck; Taiwan pr. [sang1 men2 xing1]

喪門神.definition: messenger of death; person bringing bad luck

喪魂失魄.definition: out of one's senses; shaken to the core; dazed

喪魂落魄.definition: scared out of one's wits (idiom); in a panic
